isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 - 1992-1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubsecinfo.para: The troubleshooting charts in this section are not designed for specific symptoms, but designed to test those circuits and components installed by International. Use DDEC diagnostics to identify the suspect circuit or system, then use these procedures to troubleshoot the suspect International circuit.
NO TESTS are performed "into" the DDEC ECM.

step2.para: Before troubleshooting, make sure that the batteries are fully charged! Check battery cables and grounds for clean, tight connections free of damage. Many of the voltage tests will give misleading readings if batteries are not fully charged.

Before troubleshooting a particular circuit, inspect connectors for pushed back, loose or damaged (spread or bent) terminals, or wires with cut strands, etc. The wires and connections must be free of damage or corrosion. When some connectors corrode, a light white residue will be present that must be removed.
Before troubleshooting, inspect the suspect circuit grounds for clean, tight connections free of damage.
